BodyPart2: I'm always trying new things, eager to learn, and try to help others with my work
Description: In my free time, I enjoy exploring my artistic side through drawing. While I experiment with various art styles, I’ve found my specialty in dark art and doodling. You can find my work on my Instagram account.
ProjectContent: Here are some of my favorite projects, going from video games to websites to applications.
InternshipContent1: I had the opportunity to work as a web full-stack intern at the
InternshipContent2: in Besançon, France, from 7th April 2025 to 30th May 2025. My mission was to create a mobile application called “Euphron”, enabling students at the Université de Franche-Comté to give or take second-hand sports equipment on a donation system. The aim is to encourage access to sport while promoting solidarity between students.

Hero.Title: Euphron
Hero.Location: Learning Centre Claude Oytana • Besançon, France

Context.Title: Context & Objectives
Context.Subtitle: Project mission and stakes
Context.Description1: I had the opportunity to work as a web full-stack intern at the Learning Centre Claude Oytana in Besançon, France, from April 2025 to May 2025. My mission was to create a mobile application called 'Euphron', enabling students at the Université de Franche-Comté to give or take second-hand sports equipment on a donation system.
Context.Description2: The creation of this application was proposed by STAPS students, following a market study on access to sports equipment in their curriculum. This study revealed that, while some schools manage to provide the necessary equipment to their students, in many others, students themselves must finance their equipment.
Context.ConstraintText: No monetary gain allowed - everything had to be free, based on student solidarity.

Role.Title: My Role
Role.Subtitle: Responsibilities & autonomous development
Role.Description: I was tasked with creating the entire web application (computer and mobile compatible) completely autonomously.
Role.Responsibility1Desc: Design on Figma for client validation

Organization.Title: Organization
Organization.Subtitle: Planning & methodology
Organization.MethodologyDesc: Weekly meetings with the library team and my internship supervisor. Using Git for versioning and Trello for task management.

TechStack.Title: Tech Stack
TechStack.Subtitle: Technologies & architecture
TechStack.JustificationDesc: I favored Vue.js because I master this framework well, unlike Angular or React. Quasar was the ideal choice for native mobile compatibility, perfectly meeting the project requirements.

Features.Title: Features
Features.Subtitle: Development & implementation
Features.HighlightDesc: Developing the real-time chat with Socket.IO was a first for me. The excellent documentation allowed me to quickly understand the concepts and successfully implement this feature.

Architecture.Title: Architecture
Architecture.Subtitle: Technical structure & data flow
Architecture.DiagramCaption: Diagram of the communication flow between the frontend (Vue/Quasar) and the backend (Express, Socket.io, MySQL).
Architecture.Description: The application architecture is based on a clear separation between the frontend, developed with Quasar/Vue.js, and the backend, built around Express, Socket.io and MySQL.
Architecture.Section1Desc: When a user interacts with the interface via their browser, their actions are handled by Vue components, which orchestrate the display and logic of the application. These components, when they need to access data or trigger server-side operations, call on dedicated JavaScript services.
Architecture.Section2Desc: In parallel with this traditional operation, the application also integrates a real-time dimension thanks to Socket.io. For features like chat or instant notifications, Vue components communicate with the server via the Socket.io client.

Security.Title: Security
Security.Subtitle: Protection & best practices
Security.Intro: During development, I learned the importance of securing against SQL injections. I implemented double protection:
Security.Method1Desc: This frontend method checks that the user is not trying to harm the application's operation using a regular expression. This expression verifies that fields (name, email, phone) do not contain suspicious characters like ' " ; -- / * , etc.
Security.Method2Desc: Prepared (or parameterized) queries offer robust protection because they:
Security.Method2Item2: Are supported by all modern SQL engines
Security.Method2Item3: Form the basis of all modern ORMs

Learning.Title: Learning
Learning.Subtitle: Skills & feedback
Learning.Technical2: Deepening web security (SQL injections, prepared queries)
Learning.Soft1: Autonomy in managing a complete project
Learning.ReflectionTitle: If I had to do it again
Learning.ReflectionDesc: I would have preferred working in a team for more efficiency. Being alone, I couldn't implement as many features as desired, although it allowed me to develop my autonomy and ability to manage a project in its entirety.

WhyPortfolioContent: This site is developed as part of my Portfolio project during the three years in the BUT. It will be continually updated to reflect my academic and personal projects.
Contact: Want to chat, collaborate or just say hello? Don't hesitate to contact me!

ContactSection.placehoder_message: What you want to tell/ask me

B.I.E.N._description: B.I.E.N. is an educational and interactive website designed to raise public awareness of the environmental impact of digital technology, and in particular the CO2 produced by technology. The main aim is to help users become more aware of the carbon footprint of the technology sector through visual and customisable data.
B.I.E.N._content: Website on climate change and technology
SteamToLinux_description: SteamToLinux is a tool designed to easily check the compatibility of your games on Linux. It uses the Steam API to access your games library and retrieves data from ProtonDB to provide comprehensive compatibility information.
SpotCLI_content: Spotify terminal client, lighter than the original application, built in C using the Spotify Web API
SpotCLI_description: SpotCLI is a terminal-based user interface for Spotify. It lets you control your Spotify account from the command line. You can search for songs, albums and playlists, and play them directly from the terminal. It's still in development due to lack of time. The aim is to make it a full Spotify client with all the features of the official client.
Moonify_content: Music player with Imgur API and Discord RPC
Moonify_description: Moonify is a command-line music player that lets you listen to music on your terminal. It is designed to be light and fast, while offering a pleasant user experience. A graphical version has also been implemented for those who are not comfortable with CLI (Command-Line Interface) interfaces, offering a better experience and handling.
Moonify_technical_learning: Learn more about Python, managing the Imgur and Discord RPC APIs, optimising performance with multithreading...
ArchLinuxTutorial_description: ArchLinuxTutorial is a comprehensive guide to installing and configuring Arch Linux. It covers everything from initial installation to advanced configuration, making it a valuable resource for beginners and experienced users alike.
ArchLinuxTutorial_technical_learning: System configuration, Service management, Package installation, User management...
ArchLinuxTutorial_soft_learning: Creation of clear and concise documentation...
ArchLinuxTutorial_challenges_learning: Dependency management, Compatibility with different versions of Arch Linux...
DnD_Prototype_description: Prototype role-playing game using the 5th edition Dungeons And Dragons rules, with a look and feel similar to a JRPG. The game is still in development, but the aim is to create a complete game with a story, characters and combat.
DnD_Prototype_technical_learning: Deeper understanding of Java, event management, game state management...
Install-UpdateDiscord_description: Install-UpdateDiscord is a Bash script that installs and updates Discord on Linux-based systems and installs the Vencord mod client. It is designed to be simple and efficient, making it easy for Linux users to install Discord.
Install-UpdateDiscord_technical_learning: More in-depth knowledge of Bash, Linux package management, Installing the Vencord mod client using Curl requests, Task automation, Error management...
Install-UpdateDiscord_challenges_learnin: Dependency management, Compatibility with different Linux distributions, Script optimisation for improved performance...
SoundBoard-Python_description: SoundBoard-Python is a sound management application for anyone. It lets you play sounds, organise them into categories and associate them with shortcut keys. It is a project currently under development, aimed at providing an intuitive user interface and advanced sound management features.
SoundBoard-Python_technical_learning: Learn more about Python, event management, using third-party libraries, handling audio and virtual audio outputs...
SoundBoard-Python_soft_learning: Communicating with users to gather feedback...
SoundBoard-Python_challenges_learning: Performance management to avoid latency, optimisation of the user interface for a better experience with the use of libraries such as “TKinter”...
Roi-des-Roses_description: Roi des Roses is a game I created in 2024 with a team of 3 students. It's a card game based on the famous “King of Tokyo” game. The aim is to be the first player to reach 20 points. The game is played by 2 players and lasts around 30 minutes. You can play against one player or against a bot.
Roi-des-Roses_technical_learning: Deepening my skills in Java and JavaFX, event management...
Roi-des-Roses_soft_learning: Working in a team of 3 people, conflict management...
Roi-des-Roses_challenges_learning: Implementing the bot's AI, optimising performance...
Vent Safe_description: VentSafe is a little personal site created for me and my boyfriend so that we can share our ideas and feelings without having to feel “I'm bothering you” and so that we can express ourselves without constraint.
Vent Safe_technical_learning: CSS and Tailwind, mastering and optimising animations and styles for less powerful devices
Vent Safe_soft_learning: Understanding the importance of communication between people, Thinking about what you say before you say it, Better understanding of my emotions and myself
Vent Safe_challenges_learning: Integration and optimisation of the use of Discord Webhooks, automated sending of private messages to notify when a text is created.
DotIC_description: DotIC (Dot Image Converter), a halftone art generator that transforms your images into works of art made up of dots of varying sizes based on luminance. The resulting effect resembles traditional printing techniques or modern dot tattooing.
DotIC_technical_learning: Deepening my knowledge of Python, image processing, and algorithm optimisation for halftone art generation.
DotIC_soft_learning: Improving my problem-solving skills, understanding user needs for better UX design.
DotIC_challenges_learning: Ensuring compatibility with various image formats, optimising performance for large images, and refining the algorithm for better dot distribution.
HFP Disable AutoScript_description: HFP Disable AutoScript is a PowerShell script that automatically disables the Hands-Free Profile (HFP) on Windows when a Bluetooth audio device is connected. This helps to improve audio quality by preventing Windows from switching to the lower-quality HFP mode.
HFP Disable AutoScript_technical_learnin: Learning PowerShell scripting, Understanding Bluetooth profiles and Windows audio management.
HFP Disable AutoScript_soft_learning: Enhancing my scripting skills, Improving my ability to research and implement technical solutions.
HFP Disable AutoScript_challenges_learni: Handling different Bluetooth devices, Ensuring compatibility across various Windows versions.

Philosophy.Title: Philosophy
Philosophy.Subtitle: My vision of development
Philosophy.Quote: While I love building applications, my true passion lies in perfecting them: making them bug-free, accessible, and user-friendly.
Philosophy.Text1: This attention to detail extends to my other projects, such as creating a comprehensive tutorial for the installation and maintenance of
Philosophy.Text3: . I focus on breaking down every step to help users overcome challenges with confidence.

Gallery.EmptyDesc: This section will soon be filled with my artistic creations.

Insta.Description: Find all my artistic creations and latest works on Instagram. Follow my creative journey daily!

1.Title: Double Skulls
1.Description: I was inspired by the music cover 'What the Fuck' from RHODAMINE.

2.Title: PFP Social Media
2.Description: I really wanted to try to draw a skeleton because I'm really obsessed with skulls, bones...

3.Title: Autel Skull
3.Description: It was a training to understand how perspective works and how to draw hand holding a big object, such as a skull

4.Title: CyberSigilism
4.Description: It was my first tattoo design, I got it tattooed on my right forearm/hand, to celebrate my graduation. It represents the choices made in life, starting with only one branch and dividing in multiple paths.

5.Title: Death Spider
5.Description: It was a request from a friend who wanted to challenge me to draw a spider in a dark art style. I really enjoyed drawing the details on the legs and the skull.

6.Title: Fuming Skull
6.Description: I saw a similar design by one of my favorite artist named 'orchard.mag' and it made me wonder if I can do something similar with my own style.

7.Title: Doodle 1
7.Description: A spontaneous doodle that came to life during a moment of inspiration.

8.Title: Doodle 2
8.Description: Another doodle, this time with a more abstract theme.
